revised_title: Glutamate-Receptor Ion Channels Kinetics in Rat Cerebellar Granule Neurons
tldr: The article investigates the kinetics of large-conductance glutamate-receptor ion channels in rat cerebellar granule neurons. The researchers found that these channels open in bursts and clusters, and they analyzed the shut-time and burst duration distributions for glutamate, aspartate, and NMDA. The study provides insights into the relation between single-channel openings and whole-cell current noise in these neurons.
